HACKING:- An beautiful and powerful art of the Digital Era.

1 Comment / Hacking / By Harshal Srivastava / August 22, 2020

Hello guys, I am Harshal and this is my first blog on the topic Hacking. Today I would be sharing my knowledge and thoughts with you all on this interesting topic Hacking. Read on to discover what hacking is and related information.

What Is HACKING?

Whenever this word “Hacking” strikes our ear we all dive into our imaginary world of movies where we see a person wearing a black hooded jacket, sitting in front of his computer, typing some kind of code on a black screen with letters being green and whatnot. Well, that’s only a movie.

Well truly speaking, according to me Hacking is an art- an art of power and beauty that cannot be owned by everyone.

The primary definition of hacking is:- “Hacking is an attempt to exploit a computer system or a private network inside a computer”.

More simply, Hacking is an unauthorized attempt to break into systems, servers, and devices connected to the internet for some illicit purpose. The people who perform these activities are called Hackers.

Types of Hackers

Now that you guys are aware of what a hacker is and the kind of stuff he performs, it’s easy to think that they’re all bad persons stealing our privacy, but that’s not true. There are several types of hackers, and some of them work for the welfare of society and the world.

Hackers have been categorized according to their intent of the action. In general, they are of 3 kinds as follows:

White Hat Hackers:

They are also called as Ethical Hackers. These peoples are Industry professional who gains access to systems with a view to fixing the identified weaknesses. They generally perform penetration testing and vulnerability assessments. These people work to make the systems more secure and work for the welfare of society.

Black Hat Hackers:

These are those notorious guys who gains unauthorized access to computer systems for personal gain. Their intent is usually to steal corporate data, violate privacy rights, transfer funds from bank accounts etc. and sometimes also to satisfy and boost their ego.

Grey Hat Hackers:

They are persons who fall in between ethical and black hat hackers. They penetrate into computer systems without authority with the intent to identify weaknesses and if successful then they would reveal them to the system owner. Along with that knowledge, these hackers offer a deal and ask for a fee to fix the vulnerability and if the owner refuses the request they post the vulnerability online for anyone to exploit.

Types of Attacks and Preventive Measures.

When hackers set out to attack, they have a huge range of hacking tools, techniques, and technical expertise at their disposal. In the following, I have shared some of the most popular and commonly used attacks and how to prevent them.

Phishing:-

Phishing attack has been a popular and favorite attacks of hackers. This attack is very similar to fishing.Phishing starts with a fraudulent email or other communication that is cleverly designed to convince the victim that the message(that usually contains a malicious link)comes from a trusted sender. Once the victim is tricked, he or she is coaxed into providing confidential information like credit card passwords. Sometimes malware is also downloaded onto the target’s computer.

Phishing can take many different forms, so there’s no single way to defend yourself but it is relatively easy to avoid if you’re careful. If an official-looking email sent you a link, make sure the URL it’s taking you to looks correct. Don’t download anything from an email unless you’re absolutely sure it’s safe.

Phishing is easy to avoid but it’s also one of the most powerful attacks out there as it has the power to bypass any of your own defenses. If the hacker wins in convincing you to do what they want, then no security software in the world can protect you from being exploited.

DOS(Denial of Services):

DoS is the acronym for Denial of Service. This has been a popular attack of all time which is a singly hosted. In DOS attack hackers make it impossible for users to access information or services such as accessing a website, network, emails, etc. or making it extremely slow. This attack is usually implemented by hitting the targeted web server with too many requests at the same time that results in server failing to respond to all the requests which lead to slowing down of server and in the worst case, it gets crashed down.

As it is a Single-origin it can be effective against undefended victims, but they have a few limitations:

  1. To kill HTTP requests victims can block the originating IP address at the firewall level
  2. To kill network-level floods victims can further upstream to the ISP level.
  3. Security tools now exist to detect and prevent ICMP flood attacks. Web servers can be configured to detect and block HTTP request attacks.

DDoS(Distributed Denial Of Services) Attack

DDOS stands for Distributed Denial of Services. This is an upgraded and the most powerful form of DoS attack which is used these days. In a DDOS attack, a lot of data packets are flooded from a variety of different sources which is a collection of hundreds of thousands of compromised machines attacking the same victim at the same time.

This effectively makes it impossible to stop the attack simply by blocking a single IP address; plus, it becomes very difficult to differentiate the user traffic from attack traffic when spread across so many points of origin.

There are a lot more on this topic. This field is itself a vast ocean and needs a very good understanding of security fundamentals.

With that said I end this blog here.

How much you liked this blog and do you guys want more such blogs related to these topics?

Thank you.

Stay safe ,stay healthy and keep smiling :).

Regards.
